docTitle.titlePart:
Vanadyl Phosphate Dihydrate, a Solid Acid: The Role
of Water in VOPO4"2H20 and its Sodium Derivatives
Nax(VWx Vv, -x O) PO4"( 2 -x) H20

byline.docAuthor:
NIEVES CASA~*, PEDRO AMOROS, RAFAEL IBAlqEZ, EDUARDO MARTINEZ-
TAMAYO, AURELIO BELTRAN-PORTER, and DANIEL BELTR,~N-PORTER**

byline.affiliation: UIBCM, Departamento de Quimica Inorgdnica, Facultad de Quimicas, Universitat de ValOncia,

front.div:
Abstract. Sodium-containing intercalates having as general formula NaxVOPOP4.(2 -x)H20 (0.25 ~< x < 0.50)
have been obtained and characterized. Orthorhombic phases, which essentially maintain the structure of the
layered oxide hydrate VOPO4.2H20 result. Intercalated sodium ions act as 'pillars'. The presence of n30 ions
in the parent VOPO4-2H20 and also in some reduced phases, is detected. The understanding of the structural role
of the water molecules is advanced and the topotactic dehydration/rehydration processes are studied. The
formation of a new metastable VOPO4.H20 phase is established.
front.keyword: Key words: Vanadyl phosphate, inclusion compounds, topotactic reactions, solid acids.
